com.dotcms.publisher.bundle.business

Interface BundleAPI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BundleAPIImpl

    public interface BundleAPI

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteAssetFromBundle(java.lang.String assetId, java.lang.String bundleId)
      deletes the Asset with the given assetId from the Bundle with the given bundleId
      void deleteBundle(java.lang.String id)
      deletes the Bundle with the given id
      Bundle getBundleById(java.lang.String id)
      returns the Bundle object with the given id, if any
      Bundle getBundleByName(java.lang.String name)
      returns the Bundle object with the given name, if any
      java.util.List<Bundle> getUnsendBundles(java.lang.String userId)
      returns a List of bundles that haven't been sent to any Environment
      java.util.List<Bundle> getUnsendBundles(java.lang.String userId, int limit, int offset)
      Returns a list on un-send (haven't been sent to any Environment) bundles filtered by owner
      java.util.List<Bundle> getUnsendBundlesByName(java.lang.String userId, java.lang.String likeName, int limit, int offset)
      Returns a list on un-send bundles (haven't been sent to any Environment) filtered by owner and name.
      void saveBundle(Bundle bundle)
      persists the given Bundle object to the underlying data layer.
      void saveBundle(Bundle bundle, java.util.List<Environment> environments)
      persists the given Bundle object, and sets the given Environment List as the destination environments of the bundle.
      void saveBundleEnvironment(Bundle b, Environment e)
      persists the given Environment as a destination of the given Bundle.
      void saveBundleEnvironments(Bundle b, java.util.List<Environment> envs)
      persists the given Environment List as a destination of the given Bundle Both the environments in the List and the bundle must exist, they will not be created.
      void updateBundle(Bundle bundle)
      updates the Bundle with the given id

    • Method Detail

      • saveBundle

        void saveBundle(Bundle bundle)
                throws DotDataException
        persists the given Bundle object to the underlying data layer.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle to be persisted
        Throws:
        DotDataException - thrown when an error in the underlying data layer occurs

      • saveBundle

        void saveBundle(Bundle bundle,
              java.util.List<Environment> environments)
                throws DotDataException
        persists the given Bundle object, and sets the given Environment List as the destination environments of the bundle. The environments included in the given List must already exist, they will not be created.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle to be persisted
        environments - the list of destination environments
        Throws:
        DotDataException - thrown when an error in the underlying data layer occurs

      • saveBundleEnvironment

        void saveBundleEnvironment(Bundle b,
                         Environment e)
                           throws DotDataException
        persists the given Environment as a destination of the given Bundle. Both the environment and the bundle must exist, they will not be created.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle whose destination the given environment will be added to
        environments - the environment to be saved as destination of the given bundle
        Throws:
        DotDataException - thrown when an error in the underlying data layer occurs

      • saveBundleEnvironments

        void saveBundleEnvironments(Bundle b,
                          java.util.List<Environment> envs)
                            throws DotDataException
        persists the given Environment List as a destination of the given Bundle Both the environments in the List and the bundle must exist, they will not be created.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle whose destination the given environments will be added to
        environments - the environments to be saves as destinations of the given bundle
        Throws:
        DotDataException - thrown when an error in the underlying data layer occurs

                                      int limit,
                                      int offset)
                                        throws DotDataException
        Returns a list on un-send (haven't been sent to any Environment) bundles filtered by owner
        Parameters:
        userId -
        limit - -1 for no limit
        offset -

        Throws:

      • getUnsendBundlesByName

        java.util.List<Bundle> getUnsendBundlesByName(java.lang.String userId,
                                            java.lang.String likeName,
                                            int limit,
                                            int offset)
                                              throws DotDataException
        Returns a list on un-send bundles (haven't been sent to any Environment) filtered by owner and name.
        This method will return a list of bundles that contains the given words (like (%likeName%))
        Parameters:
        userId -
        likeName -
        limit - -1 for no limit
        offset -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        DotDataException
